conclusion: Particle A accelerates from t = 0 to t = t₀, its velocity rising from 0 to 2v₀.
Particle B accelerates from t = 0 to t = 5t₀, its velocity rising from 0 to v₀.
Calculate acceleration for A: a_A = (2v₀ – 0) / t₀ = 2v₀ / t₀.
Calculate acceleration for B: a_B = (v₀ – 0) / (5t₀) = v₀ / (5t₀).
Form the ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations: a_A : a_B = 2 : (1/5) = 10 : 1.
The magnitude of particle A’s acceleration is ten times that of particle B; the ratio is |a_A| : |a_B| = 10 : 1.
